SENT.plain: Dissections of the carotid and vertebral arteries are the common cause of stroke in young and middle-aged people
The incidence and prevalence are difficult to define, because dissection may be asymptomatic and patients with mild symptoms may not undergo extensive investigation
Cervicocephalic artery dissections have a wide spectrum of precipitating factors, symptoms and signs
Authors report an unusual case of carotid artery dissection with favourable outcome
